thread.title: Pattaya partners with private sector to support underprivileged children through HHN Foundation
thread.title_full: Pattaya partners with private sector to support underprivileged children through HHN Foundation

author: Pattaya Mail
title: Pattaya partners with private sector to support underprivileged children through HHN Foundation
text:
Pattaya Deputy Mayor Wuthisak Rurmkitjakarn and YGM Hotel executives present donated items to the HHN Foundation, helping underprivileged children in the city. PATTAYA, Thailand – Pattaya City officials, led by Deputy Mayor Wuthisak Rurmkitjakarn, joined forces with YGM Hotel Co., Ltd. to donate essential items to the HHN Foundation for Thai Children. The donation aims to support the foundation’s ongoing work assisting underprivileged children, with Director Ratchata Chomjinda and her team receiving the contributions.
The HHN Foundation, established in 2008, provides care, protection, and support to children, youth, and disadvantaged groups. Over the past decade, the foundation has helped more than 1,000 beneficiaries.
YGM Hotel’s initiative reflects its commitment to corporate social responsibility and fostering collaboration between the public and private sectors. The event highlights the role of government, businesses, and charitable organizations in supporting vulnerable communities and promoting a positive image for Pattaya.
